ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Guild Loot Rules
ygData.msgSnippet: This happens a lot in our guild too.  The pressure gets to me too quite often.  Its funny how people tell me oh you re in an uber guild you must get all
ygData.messageBody:
This happens a lot in our guild too. The pressure gets to me too quite
often. Its funny how people tell me "oh you're in an 'uber' guild you must
get all sorts of loot" or "oh how fun to go on big raids every night!" I
guess the grass is always greener because there are nights where I would
kill to play an alt but can't due to guild policy and needs. Its truly a
different game. "Fun" becomes something you look forward to having once in
a while. Hmm maybe I need a break.

Halana/Tani
<Paradigm>
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
> [mailto:garramone@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 10, 2001 9:04 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Guild Loot Rules
>
>
> Aye without participation we could not kill the things we
> want to kill. I
> had become a casual player, or even less, so that is one
> reason I decided to
> go. Casual players can get loot, but it is only going to be
> after everyone
> else has what they want, and if you are lucky enough that the
> mob you want
> something off is still being killed.
>
> I don't think I would have been kicked out or anything, but I
> also wasn't
> contributing anymore. Most of the guild plays every night or
> at least 6
> nights a week from 5:30pm on. Recently it was asked (or
> ordered, however
> you want to see it hehe) that every member attend at least 1
> raid per week,
> which isn't much to ask at all but I wasn't even doing that
> much when I
> quit.
>
> Shada
>
> > I had seen one of your previous posts a long time ago on this
> > subject, but
> > couldn't find it. A very involved system. I'm guessing that
> > there aren't
> > any casual gamers in Afterlife, or if they are, they don't go
> > on raids or
> > if they do, they just know they will not get any loot.
> >
> > It definitely slants rewards to the full time player: Keep up
> > or drop out.
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
